commands.description: Create an SSH session to a dyno
commands.help:
[1mUsage:[22m heroku ps:exec [34m[flags][39m

[1mCreate an SSH session to a dyno[22m

[34mFlags:[39m
 -a, --app APP        [2mapp to run command against[22m
 -d, --dyno DYNO      [2mspecify the dyno to connect to[22m
 -r, --remote REMOTE  [2mgit remote of app to use[22m
 --ssh                [2muse native ssh[22m
 --status             [2mlists the status of the SSH server in the dyno[22m

Example:

    $ heroku ps:exec 'node -i' --app murmuring-headland-14719
helpLine: [2mCreate an SSH session to a dyno[22m

commands.description: Launch a SOCKS proxy into a dyno
commands.help:
[1mUsage:[22m heroku ps:socks [34m[flags][39m

[1mLaunch a SOCKS proxy into a dyno[22m

[34mFlags:[39m
 -a, --app APP        [2mapp to run command against[22m
 -d, --dyno DYNO      [2mspecify the dyno to connect to[22m
 -r, --remote REMOTE  [2mgit remote of app to use[22m

Example:

    $ heroku ps:socks --app murmuring-headland-14719
    Establishing credentials... done
    SOCKSv5 proxy server started on port 1080
    Use CTRL+C to stop the proxy
helpLine: [2mLaunch a SOCKS proxy into a dyno[22m

commands.description: Forward traffic on a local port to a dyno
commands.help:
[1mUsage:[22m heroku ps:forward PORT [34m[flags][39m

[1mForward traffic on a local port to a dyno[22m

[34mFlags:[39m
 -a, --app APP              [2mapp to run command against[22m
 -d, --dyno DYNO            [2mspecify the dyno to connect to[22m
 -p, --localPort LOCALPORT  [2mthe local port to use[22m
 -r, --remote REMOTE        [2mgit remote of app to use[22m

Example:

    $ heroku ps:forward 8080 --app murmuring-headland-14719
helpLine: [2mForward traffic on a local port to a dyno[22m

commands.description: Copy a file from a dyno to the local filesystem
commands.help:
[1mUsage:[22m heroku ps:copy FILE [34m[flags][39m

[1mCopy a file from a dyno to the local filesystem[22m

[34mFlags:[39m
 -a, --app APP        [2mapp to run command against[22m
 -d, --dyno DYNO      [2mspecify the dyno to connect to[22m
 -o, --output OUTPUT  [2mthe name of the output file[22m
 -r, --remote REMOTE  [2mgit remote of app to use[22m

Example:

    $ heroku ps:copy FILENAME --app murmuring-headland-14719
helpLine: [2mCopy a file from a dyno to the local filesystem[22m
